## Day 1
::: {.callout-note collapse="true"}
## DAY 1: OPENING AND KEYNOTE LECTURES

**⏰ 9:00 AM – 9:30 AM**: Registration 

Participants check in and receive program materials.

**⏰ 9:30 AM – 9:45 AM**: Welcome Address by The Host & Co-hosts – **Dean Basic Medical Sciences, Director CBR and H.O.D Physiology BUK.** 

**⏰ 9:45 AM – 10:00 AM**: Introduction to the Event- PCATI-2025 - **Prof. Nafisa Yusuf Wali, Dr. Basheer Isah Waziri BUK & Dr. AbdulWasiu Popoola FUD.**

Overview of the event’s aims and purpose, including an introduction to The Physiological Society, its membership benefits, and its contributions to promoting physiology and physiologists worldwide.

**⏰ 10:00 AM – 10:45 AM**: Keynote Lecture 1- Expanding Career Horizons in Physiology; Insights into diverse career opportunities in academia, industry, and clinical practice. (***Prof. I.U Yarube - BUK***)

**⏰ 10:45 AM – 11:15 AM**: Tea Break and Networking

**⏰ 11:15 AM – 11:35 AM**: Basic Life Support Awareness Campaign – **BLS TEAM BUK**

**⏰ 11:40 AM – 12:25 PM**: Keynote Lecture 2- Revolutionizing Physiology Education with Emerging Technologies (***Prof. Samuel Odeh, UNIJOS***)

**⏰ 12:25 PM – 1:00 PM**: – Remarks by The Invited Guests

**⏰ 1:00 PM – 2:00 PM**: Lunch Break

**⏰ 2:00 PM – 3:00 PM**: Invited Talk: The Role of AI in Teaching and Research (***Prof. Maryam Dewu, ABU***) and Discussants

**⏰ 3:00 PM – 4:00 PM**: Breakthrough Session: Innovative Tools for Physiology Teaching and Research Introduction to Virtual Reality (VR) & Learning Management System (LMS) for Teaching and Research (***Dr. Abulwasiu B. Popoola (FUD) and Engr. Nura Waziri (AKTH)***) 


**⏰ 4:20 PM – 4:30 PM**: Summary of Day 1 & Closing
:::

## Day 2
::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"}
## DAY 2: PRACTICAL TRAINING WORKSHOPS

**⏰ 9:00 AM – 9:30 AM**: Recap of Day 1 and Morning Briefing

**⏰ 9:45 – 10:30 AM**: Keynote Lecture 4- Mentorship and Networking for Career Growth: Perspectives from senior physiologists and emerging leaders. (**Prof. Fatima Dawud, ABU**) 

**⏰ 10:30 AM – 1:30 PM**: Practical Workshops Sessions

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group A**: Molecular Biology Techniques (DNA extraction, PCR, and gel electrophoresis) - Facilitators: **Dr. Nasiru Abdullahi (KIRCT), Malam Ibrahim (CBR), Mr. Pedro (CBR)**

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group B**: Learning Management System (LMS) – Facilitator: **Dr. Abdulwasiu B. Popoola (FUD)**

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group C**: Use of Referencing Tools & Data Analysis (Zotero, SPSS) – Facilitator: **Dr. Ibrahim Yusuf Ibrahim (KIRCT)**

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group D**: Virtual Reality – Facilitator: **Eng. Nura Waziri (AKTH/Pentest)**

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group E**: CODA Non-invasive Blood Pressure System – Facilitator: **Malama Samirah Yahuza Bello (CBR)**

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group F**: Basic Life Support – **BLS Team BUK**

**⏰ 1:30 PM – 2:20 PM**: Lunch Break



**⏰ 2:30 – 3:30 PM**: Round table Discussions (**Participants to be divided into four groups for discussions**)

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group 1**: Challenges and Innovations in Physiology Teaching

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group 2**: Building Research Excellence in LMICs

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group 3**: Interdisciplinary Collaborations in Physiology – Challenges and the Way Forward

**👨‍👩‍👦‍👦 Group 4**: Harnessing Effective Mentorship for Young Physiologists

**⏰ 3:30 PM – 4:00 PM**: Group Presentation (Groups 1 – 4)

**⏰ 4:15 PM – 4:45 PM:** Summary of Day 2 & Closing

**⏰4:45 PM – 5:00 PM** – Summary & Closure. 
:::

## Day 3
::: {.callout-note collapse="true"}
## DAY 3: TRAINING, PRESENTATIONS, AND CLOSING

**⏰ 9:00 AM – 9:15 AM** – Recap of Day 2 and Morning briefing

**⏰ 9:20 AM – 9:55 AM**: Tea Break and Networking

**⏰ 10:00 AM – 10:45 AM**: Keynote Lecture 4- Transforming Physiology Skills into Global Impact. (***Prof. Olorunshola Kolawole – UNIABUJA***)

**⏰ 10:50 AM – 1:20 PM**:Practical Workshops – Final Sessions Continuation for Groups A - F

**⏰1:30 PM – 2:20 PM:** Lunch Break

**⏰ 2:20 PM – 3:25 PM**: Participant Presentations
	Groups showcase learnings, skills acquired & project ideas developed during the workshops.

**⏰ 3:30 PM – 3:45 PM**: Summary and overview of strategies to sustain continuation of the program 

**⏰ 3:45 PM – 4:15 PM**: Closing, special recognitions and concluding remarks.
:::
